reviewText:
Description from the back of the cover:

FRANKLIN AND THE SECRET CLUB - When Porcupine, jealous of Franklin's popularity, creates a Secret Club for the sole purpose of keeping him out of it, Franklin teaches her the true meaning of friendship.  FRANKLIN IS MESSY - Franklin has the messiest room going. He also has the best toy sword going. However, it's not until Franklin accidentally steps on his prized sword hidden beneath all the junk that he realizes the merits of "a place for everything".  Video runs approximately 25 minutes.

Time stops at midnight at the Senior Prom for five students, one murderous counselor, and John. They must find the courage to face themselves or, when time starts again, they may find that they are joining John's Club. All you have to do is commit murder... or suicide.
A must have for your movie collection. Very well done...two ways you can get in, suicide or murder. And in the end the result is the same the demons always win thru one means or another;)
I've never seen this movie before. I probably would 've liked it more as a teenager. Now, it's just a bit annoying. For me, it's just ok.
Two detectives solve murders in rural England.  I would recommend this DVD set to anyone who likes to watch murder mysteries.
I bought these for my mom bc she like British murder mysteries and she is crazy fond of these shows.
Rip off.  Got stuck with this one.  Not the 2nd on a and e series.  Be sure and watch for  Acorn sets and A and E series.

A senior prom is being held in a castle. At midnight everyone disappears except for a hand full of students who must fend off a psychopathic serial killer (Kim Coates) and a shape shifting demon (J.H. Wyman). The students must face their own fears to survive. Wymen provided us with a demon with personality, capitalizing on the success of the "Freddy" franchise.

The film was okay. It is dated to the 90's and has lost its cool appeal. Now available on an 8 film mutti-pack.

Parental Guide: F-bomb, sex, minor nudity (Kelli Taylor)

The Club is a movie that I really enjoyed as a teenager. I rented it at my local video store and have thought back fondly on it ever since. I don't want to give away too much of the plot, but there was an original concept here that made this movie memorable and fun. I also thought the acting was great for this type of film, especially from Zack Ward. I have held onto my VHS copy of this movie for years, desperately waiting on a DVD release. Well, I recently did find it on a "8 Movies Horror Movie Collection" in the $5 bin of a department store. It was one of the movies on this collection. I was so happy that I wanted to cheer right there in the store. I would love to review that disc here on Amazon, but it doesn't appear to be available here yet. If you are a fan of this movie, just know that there is a DVD out there that you might get lucky enough to track down for $5 (with seven other films as a bonus).

Time stops at a school dance were a group of students and a rapist teacher. must face Hell. And For some enter the Club. There is also scene were schooling of Hell must take place can these students survive Hell or will they become part of Hell. Demonology
John Nicols has been my favorite for years.  His approach and his calm ways plus in own family relationships make it worth watching. Ed Ford

Midsomer Murders is an awesome series staring John Nettles...this PBS series move quickly and always leave you remembering the story lines for ages after you've seen it.  I would recommend this series to any mystery buff who loves a good yarn and occasional laugh.
It's one of those movies that stays in your mind for a while... I was in love with this move as a teenager and never forgot it, but most people don't have any idea about this movie.  I'd say buy it.
